result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Juarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 4 days Huber for non-payment consecutive to any other sentence.
Huber with standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by Friday, 5/27/2016 at 5:00 p.m.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric J Juarez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: filed in Court by Attorney Mcmurray
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Eric J Juarez in court with attorney Mcmurray.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Mcmurray makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1
Sentence of:
10 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by Friday 5/27/2016 @ 5:00p.m.
FINE or COSTS:  $243.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid within 90 days. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 4 days in Huber consecutive
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Eric J Juarez in court, in custody,  with attorney McMurray for Jess Martinez.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Eric J Juarez in court with attorney Mcmurray for Jess Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Next date is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Eric J Juarez in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
